document.heading: Water Pollution Control Amendment Act of 2005

history.narrative: Law 16-57, the “Water Pollution Control Amendment Act of 2005”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-361 which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 1, 2005, and December 6, 2005, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 22, 2005, it was assigned Act No. 16-219 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-57 became effective on March 8, 2006.
